    As soon as menopause hit her, and for years after that, Linda, a dear friend of mine, just stopped sleeping.


    No, not by her own choice. She just couldnt fall asleep. Shed tell me,


    I am never quite awake enough to feel energized, or tired enough to get restful sleep... I just lie in bed tossing and turning, or when I do eventually fall asleep, I wake up when its still dark outside and can never go back to sleep.

    Linda and I have some years between us, so even though I hadn't experienced this phase of life yet, the thought of eventually facing the same fate was daunting enough to keep me up at night.

    While the thought of these sleepless nights were keeping me up, Linda was, for lack of a better phrase, losing her mind.


    Shed stay up all night, riddled with anxiety, and then the next morning, shed be exhausted, irritable, and have no energy to perform even the most mundane, day-to-day tasks.

    On some days, shed get tired around 6 PM, go to bed by 7, wake around 1 or 2 AM, and then stay up all night.


    As if dealing with the life-changing impact of menopause wasnt enough, the absence of sleep was turning out to be too much for Linda. She thought she was slipping into depression.


    I just want to sleep," shed say with her sunken, dark, lifeless eyes that looked like they hadnt gotten a peaceful, restful sleep in years.

    On days when shed speak to me, which became fewer as time went by, shed just sound so low and sad.


    I feel like I am stuck in a maze. I just roam around my house like a ghost. Ive tried so many things; I even started exercising. But theres nothing that makes me tired enough to sleep, shed say. Once, she told meshe hadnt slept properly in over 2 weeks.

    That was one of the last times I spoke to her.


    Until she found what she thought was the solution to her sleep problems and called me with the good news.


    For the first time in ages, I could sense excitement in her voice.


    Theyre called sleep gummies! Everyones taking them. Theyre like gummy bears that make you fall asleep within minutes! You know the best part? I can just order them online and pick any flavor I want. Do you know what this means?! I can finally feel and function like a human again!

    She told me as she placed her first order of these melatonin gummies.

    Her face was glowing and lively again, she went out more, she could once again do her chores around the house, got back to her one true love: cooking, and she just seemed like she had gained control over her life again.


    I feel like I am living my best life again," shed say.And she was; until she wasnt.

    You see, not getting proper sleep wreaks HAVOC on a person's mind and body. It does things like:

    Your attention and concentration abilities disappear. Your memory and decision-making skills also start to fade.


    You go through many mood swings in a single day, youre highly irritable, and constantly stressed, anxious, and in some cases, even depressed.


    Your skin begins to look dull and dry with increased wrinkles and fine lines.


    Sleep deficiency can also make it difficult to drive or operate machinery, increasing the risk of accidents and injuries.


    Your immune system can also become weaker, making you more susceptible to infections, illnesses, and chronic diseases.


    Lack of sleep can also lead to increased hunger, cravings for high-calorie foods, weight gain, and an increased risk of obesity and metabolic disorders.


    Sleep deprivation is also associated with an increased risk of cardiovascular concerns.

    Is your Sleep Aid

    really Aiding your Sleep?

    Besides being a hormone thats as easy to purchase as ice cream, melatonin sleep supplements can really mess up your physiological and psychological well-being.


    Because these melatonin sleep aids are classified as a dietary supplement, they are not subject to the same level of scrutiny as medications approved by Australia's Therapeutic Goods Administration (TGA). While manufacturers and distributors are expected to meet TGA standards, there is no systematic process to guarantee that the melatonin you purchase is exactly as described on the label.


    Basically, you are at the mercy of these melatonin supplement manufacturers, hoping their ingredient labels contain factual information.


    But who in the world would trust these big pharma guys to be 100% honest and transparent?


    The recommended melatonin dose for most people is 0.3mg, and no more than 0.5mg. Definitely NOT 3mg, or 5, or 10 or 20! which is what many companies sell.

    Crazy, right?

    You know whats crazier?

    SOME MELATONIN GUMMIES CONTAIN 478% MORE MELATONIN THAN THE LABEL READS.

    CASE STUDY 1


    According to a research team that tested 25 melatonin sleep gummy products, chewable melatonin supplements sold as over-the-counter sleep aids may contain potentially dangerous levels of the hormone.


    The researchers found that 22 of the 25 products sampled contained significantly different amounts of melatonin than advertised. Another had gummies packing nearly 3.5 times more melatonin than the labeled quantity.

    CASE STUDY 2


    In 2017, researchers from the University of Guelph systematically analyzed 31 melatonin supplements that were purchased from local stores. These supplements spanned 16 different brands and included a representative sample of formulations, including liquids, capsules, and chewable tablets.


    What they uncovered was troubling (to say the least): "Compared to the label on the bottle, melatonin content varied from 83% less than what was written, all the way up to 478% more than what was labeled."


    The researchers explained that they anticipated some samples may have decreased melatonin content because of known degradation and stability issues, but they struggled to explain why so many samples had more melatonin.

    Does any of this sound like something youd want to take right before you sleep or at any other time of the day?

    Well, simply because big pharma does not care about you or your health. They just want to sell their products to whoever will fall for their false claims and marketing.

    #1 - If you are on medication, melatonin is not for you

    Melatonin supplements can interact with certain medications commonly used by older adults , such as blood thinners and medications for high blood pressure. This can lead to adverse effects or reduced effectiveness of either your medication or the melatonin supplement.


    #2 Older adults are typically more sensitive to melatonin

    Older adults may be more sensitive to the sedative effects of melatonin, which can lead to increased daytime drowsiness and impaired cognitive function. This can increase the risk of falls and accidents.


    #3 Melatonin can make your sleep worse

    Melatonin supplements may alter the natural sleep architecture, including the balance of REM (rapid eye movement) and non-REM sleep stages. Disruptions to sleep architecture can affect sleep quality and may not provide restorative benefits of natural sleep.


    #4 It doesnt target the root cause

    Older adults are more likely to have underlying health conditions that can affect sleep, such as sleep apnea, restless leg syndrome, or insomnia disorders - all of which melatonin supplements may not be able to address.


    #5 You can slip into melatonin dependency

    Long-term use of melatonin supplements may lead to dependence or tolerance, where higher doses are needed to achieve the same effects. This can make it challenging to discontinue melatonin use without experiencing withdrawal symptoms or rebound insomnia.

    Valerian

    Valerian

    Valerian has been used throughout history for its sleep-aiding properties. The West has been using Valerian for a long, long time and it is already a pretty famous ingredient. Hippocrates talked about the importance of Valerian in the 2nd century, while Galen recommended Valerian to ease people into getting a good nights sleep.


    Valerian has also found its place in ancient Ayurvedic texts, Susrat Samhita and Charak Samhita, as the herb used to calm the mind and help it sleep and rest. Rich in valenol, beta-sitosterol, lignans, and linoleic acid, Valerian is also described as being beneficial for the eyes.

    Valerian is good for you because it is:

    01. The ultimate sleep inducer

    Frequently Asked Questions

    1. Are Fairy Farms Sleep Gummies suitable for children?

    We know the gummies are delicious but please note, Sleep Gummies are not recommended for children and should be consumed by adults (above the age of 18 years) only.

    2. Can pregnant or nursing individuals safely consume Fairy Farms Sleep Gummies?

    Well first off, congratulations! Pregnant or lactating mothers should consult their healthcare provider before consuming Sleep Gummies.

    3. Can Fairy Farms Sleep Gummies be taken by people with specific health conditions or those who are taking medications?

    Those with a specific health condition, medication, or planning a medical procedure should consult their healthcare provider before consumption of Fairy Farms Sleep Gummies.

    4. When is the best time to consume Fairy Farms Sleep Gummies for optimal sleep health?

    Pop 2 to 4 gummies about half an hour before you go to bed. The gummies will take effect soon and help you feel more relaxed, while your eyes will droop all ready to fall in the sweet embrace of sleep.

    5. What are the ingredients used in Fairy Farms Sleep Gummies?

    Fairy Farms Sleep Gummies contain -

    • Hemp Extract

    • Valerian


    Apart from these Ayurvedic super-herbs, Sleep Gummies are made using pectin (not Gelatin) and brown sugar (which is the healthier alternative as it is less processed than regular white sugar).


    It also contains -

    • Maltitol

    • Malic Acid

    • Sodium Citrate

    • Natural Color

    • Natural Blueberry Flavor

    6. Is Fairy Farms' Sleep Gummies a vegan product?

    Yes, Fairy Farms’ Sleep Gummies is vegan. The active ingredients being used are Hemp Extract and Valerian roots. The gummies are made using pectin, which is plant-derived instead of gelatin, which is a cheaper, animal-derived gelling agent.

    7. Are there any allergens in Fairy Farms’ Sleep Gummies?

    Sleep Gummies are Gluten Free. They do not contain any ingredients that are known allergens. However, please note that they are processed in a facility that handles soy, peanuts, tree nuts, milk, and wheat. Please read the ingredient list carefully before consuming if you have any known allergy.
